titleStmt.title: C. P. Taylor to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9273

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Hon Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Charles P Taylor would represent that at the last term of the Barren Equity & Criminal Court he was fined Sixty Five Dollars for an assault -- He states that the man that he was charged with assaulting, had a buised and slandered his wife
That he is poor, and unable ine Justice to his family to pay said fine that he asked your honor to exercise your clemency in remitting said fine & will ever pray
The undersigned say that C. P. Taylor the petitioner above, is a hard working clever man, & we Join him in asking that his fine be remitted & will ever pray

N. T. Johnson
H A Jordan
Wm Bybee
Thomas Groom
J M Doty
A Moaten
P. T. Hudson J P B C
V A Jones
A. Crenshaw
B. A Davidson

Isd Jay 13. 1860
$65 } Assault
Chas P. Taylor
